market_summary: US markets mixed: SPY down 0.06% to 691.96, QQQ down 0.39% to 613.11 on Feb 11. Volatility elevated with tech under pressure.

Mega-cap earnings cycle complete: AAPL Q1 rev +40% YoY to $143.8B, MSFT Q2 rev +4.6% to $81.3B, GOOGL Q4 rev +11% to $113.8B, META Q4 rev +17% to $59.9B, AMZN Q4 rev +18% to $213.4B. AI capex theme dominates.
Financials weak on Feb 12: JPM -3.59%, BAC -3.35%, WFC -3.69%, C -5.76%. Energy mixed: XOM -2.07%. Defensives outperform: utilities (NEE +1.16%, DUK +1.48%), healthcare (LLY +2.30%, UNH +1.47%).

thesis: Strong fundamental quality: JPM delivered Q3 EPS $5.07 (+2.7% YoY), Q2 EPS $5.24, Q1 EPS $5.07, all beating $5. ROE 15.7%, net margin 31.6%, operating margin 39.8%. Asset-light financials model with dominant market position.

Attractive valuation on weakness: P/E 14.6x vs 5-year avg ~12-15x, P/B 2.29x. Feb 12 selloff (-3.59%) creates entry at $301 vs recent highs. Trading below tech multiples despite comparable quality metrics.

Positive estimate revisions catalyst: Q3 beat consensus, raised NII guidance. Analyst targets avg $230-250 imply upside. Rising rate environment into 2026 benefits NIM expansion. Payout ratio 28% supports 4.7% div + buybacks.
risks: Rate cycle reversal: If Fed cuts rates faster than expected in 2H 2026, NIM compression could pressure earnings. Interest rate sensitivity is primary macro risk.
Credit cycle deterioration: Consumer loan delinquencies or commercial real estate stress could require reserve builds, impacting EPS. Monitor charge-off trends quarterly.
Regulatory overhang: Basel III endgame capital requirements or new bank regulations could constrain capital return or ROE. Political risk into 2026 elections.
falsifiable_checks: Q4 2025 (Jan 2026 report): EPS must exceed $4.80 and NII guidance must be maintained or raised. Any reserve build >$2B or credit deterioration is exit signal.
Price target: If JPM trades below $280 for 3 consecutive days without macro shock, or fails to hold $290 support after earnings, reassess thesis.

Q3 earnings beat + guidance raise + 30-day window for estimate revisions to flow through.
